briefTitle: Azithromycin and Ampicillin for Late PPROM
officialTitle: Azithromycin and Ampicillin for Late PPROM

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Maternal age 18-50
* Premature rupture of membranes
* Gestational age 34.0 and 36.4 weeks
* Singleton pregnancy

Exclusion Criteria:

* Multiple gestations
* Individuals in active labor (defined as 3 cm dilatation and 80% effacement or more. or regular uterine construction of more than 4 in 10 minutes)
* Meconium stain amniotic fluid
* Non-reassuring fetal heart rate or status
* Maternal or fetal indication for labor:

  * Suspected Chorioamnionitis
  * Suspected placental abruption
  * Any maternal morbidity requiring labor
* Cervical cerclage in place.
* Major fetal malformation or known chromosomal abnormalities.
* Stillbirth.
* Sensitivity to Macrolides Antibiotics

primary.measure: A composite of neonatal adverse outcomes
primary.description:
A composite of neonatal adverse outcomes defined as the occurrence of one or more of the following events within 72 hours after birth:

use of continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) or high-flow nasal cannula, supplemental oxygen with a fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2) ≥0.30 for ≥4 continuous hours, extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), mechanical ventilation, neonatal sepsis (defined as positive blood culture), hypoglycemia requiring treatment, hyperbilirubinemia requiring phototherapy, stillbirth, or neonatal death within 72 hours after delivery

The composite will be reported as the number of infants who experience at least one of the listed adverse outcomes.

Unit of Measure: Number of infants with ≥1 adverse outcome
primary.timeFrame: From the time of birth until 72 hours postpartum

secondary.measure: Number of Infants With Severe Respiratory Morbidity
secondary.description: Includes infants requiring CPAP or high-flow nasal cannula for ≥12 hours or mechanical ventilation, or neonatal death
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through neonatal hospitalization or up to 28 days of life, whichever comes first.

secondary.measure: Number of Infants Requiring Resuscitation at Birth
secondary.description: Any newborn requiring active resuscitation immediately after birth
secondary.timeFrame: At birth

secondary.measure: Number of Infants Diagnosed With Respiratory Distress Syndrome
secondary.description: Based on clinical signs, FiO₂ \>0.21, and characteristic chest X-ray findings
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through neonatal hospitalization or up to 28 days of life, whichever comes first

secondary.measure: Number of Infants Receiving Surfactant Therapy
secondary.description: Administration of surfactant during hospitalization
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through neonatal hospitalization or up to 28 days of life, whichever comes first.

secondary.measure: Number of Infants Diagnosed With Transient Tachypnea of the Newborn
secondary.description: Tachypnea resolving within 72 hours after birth
secondary.timeFrame: Within first 72 hours after birth

secondary.measure: Number of Infants Diagnosed With Necrotizing Enterocolitis
secondary.description: Clinical diagnosis of NEC during hospitalization
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through neonatal hospitalization or up to 28 days of life, whichever comes first.

secondary.measure: Number of Infants With Grade 3 or 4 Intraventricular Hemorrhage
secondary.description: Diagnosed by cranial ultrasound or imaging during hospitalization
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through neonatal hospitalization or up to 28 days of life, whichever comes first.

secondary.measure: Number of Infants With Feeding Intolerance
secondary.description: Clinical diagnosis of feeding intolerance during hospitalization
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through neonatal hospitalization or up to 28 days of life, whichever comes first.

secondary.measure: Number of Infants With NICU Stay Exceeding 3 Days
secondary.description: Length of NICU admission greater than three days
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through neonatal hospitalization or up to 28 days of life, whichever comes first

secondary.measure: Number of Infants Diagnosed With Pneumothorax
secondary.description: Radiologically confirmed pneumothorax during hospitalization
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through neonatal hospitalization or up to 28 days of life, whichever comes first

secondary.measure: Number of Infants Diagnosed With Meconium Aspiration Syndrome
secondary.description: Clinical diagnosis during hospitalization
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through neonatal hospitalization or up to 28 days of life, whichever comes first

secondary.measure: Number of Infants Diagnosed With Birth Asphyxia
secondary.description: Clinical diagnosis of perinatal asphyxia during hospitalization
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through neonatal hospitalization or up to 28 days of life, whichever comes first

secondary.measure: Number of Infants Diagnosed With Periventricular Leukomalacia
secondary.description: Diagnosed by imaging during hospitalization
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through neonatal hospitalization or up to 28 days of life, whichever comes first

secondary.measure: Number of Infants With Neonatal Convulsions
secondary.description: Clinically diagnosed seizures during hospitalization
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through neonatal hospitalization or up to 28 days of life, whichever comes first

secondary.measure: Number of Neonatal Deaths
secondary.description: Death of the newborn during hospitalization
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through neonatal hospitalization or up to 28 days of life, whichever comes first

secondary.measure: Distribution of Placental Histopathology Lesion Types
secondary.description: Classification of placental lesions according to standardized pathology criteria, including maternal vascular malperfusion lesions, fetal vascular malperfusion lesions, inflammatory lesions, and other abnormalities. Each placenta will be categorized based on pathology report
secondary.timeFrame: Within 6 weeks after delivery, upon receipt of pathology results

secondary.measure: Number of Infants With Positive Placental Cultures
secondary.description: Number of infants whose placental tissue culture was positive for bacterial growth
secondary.timeFrame: Within 6 weeks after delivery, upon receipt of culture results

secondary.measure: Distribution of Bacterial Species in Positive Placental Cultures
secondary.description: Identification and classification of bacterial species isolated from positive placental tissue cultures. Each positive culture will be categorized by bacterial genus and speciesWithin 4 weeks after delivery, upon receipt of culture results
secondary.timeFrame: Within 4 weeks after delivery, upon receipt of culture results

secondary.measure: Latency From Randomization to Delivery
secondary.description: Number of days from randomization until delivery
secondary.timeFrame: From randomization until delivery

secondary.measure: Number of Participants Completing Full Course of Antenatal Corticosteroids
secondary.description: Completion of full corticosteroid course for fetal lung maturity
secondary.timeFrame: From randomization until delivery

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Placental Abruption
secondary.description: Clinically diagnosed placental abruption
secondary.timeFrame: From randomization until delivery

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Intrapartum Fever (≥ 38°C)
secondary.description: Maternal fever occurring during labor
secondary.timeFrame: During labor

secondary.measure: Number of Participants Diagnosed With Clinical Chorioamnionitis
secondary.description: Diagnosis based on uterine tenderness and/or maternal fever related to suspected uterine infection
secondary.timeFrame: From randomization until delivery

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Bacteremia (Positive Blood Culture)
secondary.description: Positive maternal blood cultures indicating bacteremia
secondary.timeFrame: From randomization until 72 hours postpartum

secondary.measure: Number of Participants Undergoing Unplanned Cesarean Delivery
secondary.description: Cesarean delivery not planned before labor onset
secondary.timeFrame: From randomization until delivery

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Postpartum Endometritis
secondary.description: Clinical diagnosis of postpartum endometritis
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery until 6 weeks post partum

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Postpartum Wound Infection or Dehiscence
secondary.description: Clinical diagnosis of wound infection or dehiscence after delivery
secondary.timeFrame: from birth and up to 6 weeks postpartum

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Composite Adverse Maternal Outcome
secondary.description: A composite of maternal adverse outcomes defined as the occurrence of one or more of the following events within 6 weeks postpartum: bacteremia, ICU admission, hysterectomy, or need for drainage or relaparotomy
secondary.timeFrame: From randomization until 6 weeks postpartum

secondary.measure: Length of Postpartum Hospital Stay
secondary.description: Number of days hospitalized postpartum
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through neonatal hospitalization or up to 28 days of life, whichever comes first

secondary.measure: Number of Participants Who Initiated Breastfeeding
secondary.description: Initiation of breastfeeding during hospital stay
secondary.timeFrame: From delivery through maternal hospital discharge or up to 28 days postpartum, whichever comes first

secondary.measure: Number of Participants Requiring Hospital Readmission
secondary.description: Any hospital readmission within 6 weeks postpartum
secondary.timeFrame: Up to 6 weeks postpartum

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Antepartum Hemorrhage
secondary.description: Clinically diagnosed bleeding before delivery
secondary.timeFrame: From randomization until delivery

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Uterine Rupture
secondary.description: Clinically diagnosed uterine rupture during labor or delivery
secondary.timeFrame: During labor or delivery

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Umbilical Cord Prolapse
secondary.description: Clinically diagnosed cord prolapse
secondary.timeFrame: From randomization until delivery

dataSource: ClinicalTrials.gov API v2 - Ultimate Complete Collection
